brief: Develop a backend service for managing course enrollments and user progress.
business_problem: Educational institutions struggle to efficiently manage student enrollments and track progress. Without streamlined systems, they risk losing students and revenue due to poor engagement.
target_users: Administrators and educators at online learning platforms
goals: Create RESTful API for course enrollment management
Integrate authentication and authorization for secure access
deliverables: Database schema for course and user data
Unit tests covering critical API endpoints
assessment_criteria: API performance, code maintainability, and alignment with user needs

user_stories.title: Enroll user in a course
user_stories.description: As an admin, I want to enroll users in courses so they can access learning materials.
acceptance_criteria: Given I have user and course IDs, when I send an enrollment request, the user is enrolled successfully.
If the user is already enrolled, an appropriate error message is returned.
The enrollment status is updated in the database within one second.

user_stories.title: Track user progress
user_stories.description: As an educator, I want to track user progress in courses to identify at-risk students.
acceptance_criteria: Given a user ID, when I request progress data, I receive a summary of completed modules.
Progress data includes timestamps for each completed module.
If no progress exists, a message indicating 'No progress found' is returned.

user_stories.title: Authenticate users securely
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to log in securely so my data remains protected.
acceptance_criteria: Given valid credentials, when I log in, I receive a secure token.
If credentials are invalid, an appropriate error message is returned.
The token allows access to protected routes for 24 hours.
